body.p: Twenty-first governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky. Harrodsburg, Kentucky, native. Married to Anna Nelson Shelby Magoffin on April 21, 1840. Father of Susan Shelby Magoffin, Beriah Magoffin, Gertrude Magoffin, Sarah Magoffin, Shelby Magoffin, Isaac Magoffin, Jane Magoffin, Letitia Magoffin, Ebenezer Magoffin, Anna Magoffin, and Samuel Magoffin. Educated at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky, and Transylvania University in Lexington, Kentucky. Practiced law in Jackson, Mississippi, and Harrodsburg, Kentucky. Real estate investor in Chicago, Illinois. Appointed Harrodsburg Police Judge in 1840. Democratic Party presidential elector in 1856. Delegate to the Democratic national convention in 1848, 1856, 1860, and 1872. Represented Mercer County in the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1850. Governor from August 30, 1859, to his resignation on August 18, 1862. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1860. President of the Military Board of Kentucky from May 24, 1861, to September 25, 1861. Member of the Democratic and Southern Rights Parties.
